name: Sanjay Halder
position: PwC India || MBA-Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur || Ex-Punjab National Bank(Dy.Manager)
about: Highly dynamic and focused Consultant presently working with PWC India in Digital Transformation coupled with rich experience of 5years with India's 2nd largest PSU in Banking, Punjab National Bank. Have an exceptional client service record and extraordinary depth of retail and corporate credit knowledge. Able to explain complex financial management concepts to a wide variety of professional and non-professional audiences. Adept at working independently or as part of a professional banking team and supervised branch business to the tune of ₹320 crores. Assessed requests from management to determine the credit risk analysis of the assigned asset portfolio to the tune of ₹ 276crores and help management making decisions on lending and credit-worthiness. Also conducted credit risk analysis by analyzing risk parameters such as the probability of default, value-at-risk, risk weighted, activity ratios and modified credit collateral requirement to secure risk exposures.

current_company.name: PwC India
current_company.title: PwC India || MBA-Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur || Ex-Punjab National Bank(Dy.Manager)

experience.title: Management Intern
experience.description: Developed a cost model considering cost drivers of raw materials of gasket and paints. Identified the cost drivers of raw materials used for making EPDM gaskets in DI Pipes. Analyzed the cost components of raw materials for paints used in the finishing line of DI pipes. Chalked out the indices parameters for the price movement of petrochemical products. Devised strategy to reduce costs for procurement and developed a cost model with 98% accuracy. Identified ways to make products more sustainable that would result in improved stakeholder response
